verses.kjv: The earth is the LORD’s, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.
verses.ct: Everything on earth belongs to the LORD — the world and all its fullness, along with everyone who lives in it.

verses.kjv: For he hath founded it upon the seas, and established it upon the floods.
verses.ct: He is the one who set its foundations over the seas and secured it above the waters.

verses.kjv: Who shall ascend into the hill of the LORD? or who shall stand in his holy place?
verses.ct: Who is worthy to climb the LORD's mountain? Who may stand in his holy place?

verses.kjv: He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.
verses.ct: The person whose actions are blameless and whose heart is pure — someone who has not devoted their soul to what is worthless or made false promises.

verses.kjv: He shall receive the blessing from the LORD, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.
verses.ct: That person will receive blessing from the LORD and righteousness from the God who saves them.

verses.kjv: This is the generation of them that seek him, that seek thy face, O Jacob. Selah.
verses.ct: These are the people who pursue him, who seek your presence, O Jacob. Selah.

verses.kjv: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.
verses.ct: Open wide, you gates! Swing open, you ancient doors, so the King of glory may enter!

verses.kjv: Who is this King of glory? The LORD strong and mighty, the LORD mighty in battle.
verses.ct: Who is this King of glory? He is the LORD, strong and powerful — the LORD, victorious in battle.

verses.kjv: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; even lift them up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.
verses.ct: Open wide, you gates! Swing open, you ancient doors, so the King of glory may enter!

verses.kjv: Who is this King of glory? The LORD of hosts, he is the King of glory. Selah.
verses.ct: Who is this King of glory? The LORD of hosts — he is the King of glory. Selah.
